summary: EPA primarily uses two legacy IT systems to manage outdoor air quality data that tribal, state, and local air monitoring agencies collect. Data from these systems helps to identify areas that don't meet air quality standards and communicate information about air pollution levels to the public. title: Air Pollution: EPA Needs to Develop a Business Case for Replacing Legacy Air Quality Data Systems
